content:
Diagnosis:
Left breast cancer - T1cN0M0 glycogen-rich variant invasive ductal carcinoma, grade 2
ER 95%, PR 85%, HER2 2+ (FISH negative)

Previous treatment:
Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy 15 January 2024
Adjuvant radiotherapy completed March 2024

Current medications:
Tamoxifen 20mg daily since April 2024

Current situation:
Routine follow-up at 3 months post-radiotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today for her first follow-up since completing adjuvant radiotherapy. She has recovered well from treatment with only mild residual breast tenderness. She is tolerating tamoxifen with minimal side effects, reporting occasional mild hot flushes. Her energy levels have improved and she has returned to work full-time.

On examination, the left breast shows expected post-treatment changes with good cosmetic outcome. No new concerning features. Performance status remains 0.

Plan is to continue current management with tamoxifen. She will have annual mammogram surveillance starting from January 2025. Next clinic review in 6 months.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: glycogen-rich variant invasive ductal carcinoma, grade 2

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

patient_facts.value: Left breast shows expected post-treatment changes with good cosmetic outcome

status_updates.value: Early stage breast cancer. Good recovery from primary treatment with minimal side effects from adjuvant tamoxifen
Annual mammogram surveillance starting from January 2025
